channel.title: Why is 317 so popular?
channel.description: I was just wondering, why is the 317 revision so popular? Why not 194? 289? How come these revisions are so overlooked?

item.title: Why is 317 so popular?
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[there|their|they’re] is no need to be upset

Read full topic

item.title: Why is 317 so popular?
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

A few reasons that I can think of…

  • Tons of tutorials for 317s
  • It’s simple, and easy to program, and it’s a good start for those who want to learn Java.
  • As a few others said, people loved that era, the 317/2006 times of Runescape, in my opinion that’s when it was at its best. Before they changed the wilderness, upgraded all the graphics, etc.

There are probably a couple more reasons I could think of if I put some time into it. The main reason I think (personally) is the fact that it’s easy to code, and good for beginners.

Read full topic

item.title: Why is 317 so popular?
item.dc:creator: @Kodiak Kodiak
item.description:
@Kodiak wrote:

[quote=“Spades, post:27, topic:460184”][quote author=m1lkman link=topic=563100.msg4104656#msg4104656 date=1347835074]
most documented
[/quote]

That, and people don’t have to put a lot of effort into their sources to add what they want to add. Or they just wait for someone to release it and they leech it. (Every PI/Delta)[/quote]

This, I wouldn’t mind seeing more Battlescape bases. Just my opinion. (Also runesource is good.)

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @R3minice R3minice
item.description:
@R3minice wrote:

Probably because popular derivations of winterlove awhile back were aimed to emulate the 317 protocol such as delta and p.i plus hundreds of tutorials and snippets are around for them

item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“RSPSIcyScape, post:23, topic:460184”]194 are mostly silabs which are barely play’d.

317 do now have 600+ anim and items , which players like.[/quote]
lol’d,

I would assume 317 would be most popular as it’s the first revision ever emulated.

item.title: Why is 317 so popular?
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:3, topic:460184”]Because a lot of people see 317 as the best and most entertaining era of RuneScape.[/quote]This is a matter of opinion, infact, I’ve never heard someone say they favorited the 317 in terms of playing Runescape (not RSPS). One of the reasons is when player updating was initially released it was for the 317 client (probably used the biggest cache he had). Revisions 400+ had encrypted maps and most people don’t/didn’t have the data.

Read full topic

item.title: Why is 317 so popular?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Alright, this really helps with it being heavily documented and such.

Read full topic

item.title: Why is 317 so popular?
item.dc:creator: @ranger_squad ranger squad
item.description:
@ranger_squad wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:19, topic:460184”][quote author=ranger squad link=topic=563100.msg4104693#msg4104693 date=1347836276]

I managed to get login working on a 194 cache & client once, never took it any further though.

Amazing. I’ve tried on multiple occasions to get that, I just get stuck after networking.

Just get a basic 317 framework that already supports login and then try to convert it. They’re not too far apart.

I did consider trying this. Maybe with Hyperion or something.

Not Hyperion, it’s too bulky. If you only want to learn login, then get something that pretty much only has login. That way, you won’t get confused
[/quote]
Something like this?[/quote]

Sure, why not? When you understand login, you’ll understand how packets are sent to the client and received from the client, and you’ll find everything a whole lot easier.

Read full topic
